trans-unit.source: Serves as the base class for all ASP.NET version 2.0 data-bound controls that display their data in hierarchical form.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class is the base class used for ASP.NET controls that retrieve data from an ASP.NET hierarchical data source control and bind user-interface elements of the control to that data for display.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> classes derive from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl>.
Page developers do not use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class directly; instead, they use controls that derive from this class.

Controls developers extend this class to create data-bound controls that work with classes that implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalDataSource> interface and classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HierarchicalDataSourceControl> and <xref:System.Web.UI.HierarchicalDataSourceView> classes.

When deriving a class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class, override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method to bind the user-interface elements of your control to data retrieved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.GetData%2A> method.
In most cases, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method is the only method you will override in your derived class.

For ASP.NET 2.0 data-bound controls, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method is the equivalent of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataBind%2A> method, and is called to bind data at run time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.GetData%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> methods.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the ID of the control from which the data-bound control retrieves its list of data items.
The ID of a control that represents the data source from which the data-bound control retrieves its data.
The default is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Retrieves a <xref href="System.Web.UI.HierarchicalDataSourceView"></xref> object that the data-bound control uses to perform data operations.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.GetData%2A> method retrieves a <xref:System.Web.UI.HierarchicalDataSourceView> object from the associated data source control by calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.GetDataSource%2A> method.
The hierarchical path of the view to retrieve.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HierarchicalDataSourceView"></xref> object that the data-bound control uses to perform data operations.
A could not be retrieved for the specified viewPath.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalDataSource"></xref> that the data-bound control is associated with, if any.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.GetData%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.GetDataSource%2A> method internally.

An <xref href="System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalDataSource"></xref> instance that represents the data source identified by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.DataSourceID"></xref> property.
The data source control identified by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.DataSourceID"></xref> property does not exist in the current container.
\- or -

The data source control identified by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.DataSourceID"></xref> property does not implement the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalDataSource"></xref> interface.
Sets the state of the control in view state as successfully bound to data.
The data-bound control maintains a value in view state that indicates whether it is currently bound to data.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.MarkAsDataBound%2A> method sets the value to `true`.
Called when one of the base data source identification properties is changed, to re-bind the data-bound control to its data.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.OnDataPropertyChanged%2A> method is called when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> is changed any time after the page's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender> event.

Called when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalDataSource"></xref> instance that the data-bound control works with raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IDataSource.DataSourceChanged"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class handles the <xref:System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalDataSource.DataSourceChanged> event to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.RequiresDataBinding%2A> property to `true`.
The source of the event, the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalDataSource"></xref> object.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains event data.
Handles the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Load"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> handles the Load event to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.RequiresDataBinding%2A> property to `true` if the HTTP request is not a postback.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains event data.
Sets the initialized state of the data-bound control before the control is loaded.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.OnPagePreLoad%2A> sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.RequiresDataBinding%2A> property to `true` in cases where the HTTP request is a postback and view state is enabled but the data-bound control has not yet been bound.
This scenario is common with controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView> where the visibility of the control is changed at run time.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref> that raised the event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
When overridden in a derived class, binds data from the data source to the control.

Implement this method instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataBind%2A> method when you derive a data-bound control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class.

Placing your control's data-binding logic in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> keeps the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.DataBinding> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataBound> events from being raised in the wrong order.

While the base <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class provides no specific implementation for this method, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method is called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method to bind the values of any user interface controls to the data that is retrieved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method.
Retrieves data from the associated data source.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method is called, after data is retrieved, to bind data to elements of the data-bound control.
Derived types override this method to retrieve data only if the default implementation is not adequate.
Verifies that the object a data-bound control binds to is one it can work with.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.ValidateDataSource%2A> method is called only in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> class's mutator (setter) for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class checks the type of the object that is set for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> property to ensure that it is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalEnumerable> or <xref:System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalDataSource> interfaces.
An object set to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource"></xref> property.
dataSource is not `null` and implements neither the nor the interface.
